description: a(n) = smallest number k such that A002487(k) = n.
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: A002487(33) = 6 and this is the first time 6 appears, so a(6) = 33.
mathematica: aa = {}; a[0] = 0; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = If[EvenQ[n], a[n/2], a[(n - 1)/2] + a[(n + 1)/2]]; Do[k = 0; While[a[k] != p, k++]; AppendTo[aa, k], {p, 0, 100}]; aa (* Artur Jasinski, Dec 06 2010 *)
prog: (PARI) fusc(n)={my(a=1, b=0);while(n,if(bitand(n, 1), b+=a, a+=b);n>>=1); b};list(N)={    my(v=vector(N),k);    forstep(n=1,9e99,2,        k=fusc(n);        if(k<=N && !v[k],            v[k]=n;            if(vecmin(v),return(v))        )    )}; \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 20 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_ and David W. Wilson, Jun 27 2002
